question:
“There was only one genuine extremist in India and that was Mr. Tilak”
Who among the following had made this remark in context with Bal Gangadhar Tilak?
explanation: Edwin Samuel Montagu served the post of the Secretary of State for India between 1917 and 1922. He was the think tank of the Montagu-Chelmsford Reforms which led to the Government of India Act 1919. According to him "There was only one genuine extremist in India and that was Mr. Tilak".
